newsitem.title: UK: Euro swaps give back gains, cracks slip 5 cts.
newsitem.headline: Euro swaps give back gains, cracks slip 5 cts.

text.p: European oil swaps were little changed after early gains were mostly reversed by weaker afternoon discussions.
The crack spread between gas oil and Brent which held at $5.65 a barrel for the first quarter next year this morning eased a five cents lower during the afternoon as gasoil futures ran out of steam.
"The cracks definitely came off late in the afternoon. All the brokers were looking for the bid," said a trader.
The subsequent quarters next year were $4.45, $4.70 and $5.05 respectively.
Swaps for physical 0.2 percent sulphur were little changed all day, holding around $5.50 a tonne above the IPE on November, $6.50 for December and $7.75 on the first quarter next year.
Jet continued weak, dipping another $1.00 a tonne after losing ground late last Friday, particularly on prompter periods.
November talked either side of $31.00 a tonne above the IPE while December was around $35.50. The first quarter next year talked no higher than $40.00 but the second was about $29.00 above the IPE.

The nearby backwardation on Brent crude CFDs deepened sharply as this weeks dates jumped 10 cents a barrel but next week fell five cents. This week's dates trading at flat to November or the equivalent of 55 cents over December and at 53 cents above December.
Wet Brent slipped slightly, trading in the range 5 to 11 cents over november compared to trade 11 cents on Friday.

Gasoline lost early gains of $2.00 a tonne but activity was thin with just a couple of outright swaps traded and a few inter-month spreads. November was pegged around $230.50 a tonne by the close with the subsequent months as follows: Dec $212.00, Jan $209.00, Feb $210.00, Mar $213.00, Apr $216.50.

Fuel swaps edged up $1.00 a tonne but ended belows the morning highs. November barges traded at $124.75 but then eased to trade at $124.50 and later $124.00. Low sulphur was quiet but pegged around $129.00 for november by the close.
